div.p: P90/12426, unit 611, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by G. Luehmann and signed by M. Melbourne, 26th Novbr. 1890

I have the honor to submit for your favorable consideration the desirability of increasing the pay of George French from 4 shillings to 5 shillings a day. This young man, who is now nearly 19 years of age, has been employed in my branch for a lengthened period during 4 days a week and has acquired a good knowledge of his duties. His term of service expires on 31st December, and I would solicit your permission, to engage him for three months more, viz. to the end of March 1891. Payment is rendered out of my vote for Contingencies, which includes "Temporary Assistance".
The Chief Secretary, G. Langridge, approved M's request on 29 November 1890 and the news was forwarded to M who replied 'with best thanks' on 2 December. T. Wilson, Under Secretary, then forwarded the file to the Commissioners of Audit 'for their information'.
See also M to T. Wilson, 3 September 1890 (in this edition as 90-09-03a), and M to G. Langridge, 24 March 1891.
